feedback:
Excellent application of the DRIVER framework throughout your work. You clearly demonstrated 6 stages: D, R, I, V, E, R2.


STRENGTHS:
- Financial APP: The student clearly built and demonstrated a working financial application that ingests news, analyzes sentiment (bullish/bearish/neutral) and assigns a numeric score, with examples shown (crypto buy headline and a neutral personal-savings article). Implementation details and a live demo description provide sufficient evidence of functional financial task performance.
- Integrate AI: The submission clearly integrates AI as a core processing step (classification, scoring, and brief explanation) tied into an automated RSS-to-Google-Sheet pipeline and demonstrates sample outputs that show the AI adds actionable value. The student describes the implementation and provides examples, meeting the requirements for a thorough, effective AI integration.

criteria.criterion_name: Financial APP: The tool functions as a financial application.
evidence: "I base it on this stock news sentiment analyzer. Uh should I worry about this headline?"
"to showcase it off um we have it reads the uh the feed, checks it uh then it figures out the date"
"so, it's just going to do a JSON so the step seven can read it and it'll tell me if it's bullish, bearish or neutral. Um, and then the score that justifies that"
criteria.driver_alignment:
- DISCOVER: Identified a financial problem/domain ("stock news sentiment analyzer") motivating the tool.
- IMPLEMENT: Described concrete implementation steps (reads RSS feed, duplicate checks, writes to Google Sheet, AI step producing JSON sentiment and score).
- REFLECT: Noted use of AI and iterative building ("used AI to help me figure out how to build this thing"), indicating awareness of design choices.
criteria.reasoning: The student clearly built and demonstrated a working financial application that ingests news, analyzes sentiment (bullish/bearish/neutral) and assigns a numeric score, with examples shown (crypto buy headline and a neutral personal-savings article). Implementation details and a live demo description provide sufficient evidence of functional financial task performance.

criteria.criterion_name: Integrate AI: The tool integrates AI capabilities effectively.
evidence: "what I did for this assignment was I got on to active pieces and I had um, used AI to help me figure out how to build this thing."

"step seven uh is where I use the AI model um to help me look at um our article. So, it's just going to do a JSON so the step seven can read it and it'll tell me if it's bullish, bearish or neutral. Um, and then the score that justifies that and then um, you know, just a one sentence uh, explanation of what the the thing is and why it got that rating."

"one top cryptocurrency to buy before it soarses according to strategist. uh bullish, very positive outlook. And this article, the article headline promotes buying a cryptocurrency with incredibly high projected return attributed to well-known crypto advocate signaling extremely positive marks uh positive market sentiment."
criteria.driver_alignment:
- Discover: Student identifies an AI-based approach (“used AI to help me figure out how to build this thing”).
- Implement: Describes concrete integration point (step seven uses an AI model to produce JSON sentiment labels, scores, and summaries) and how it fits into the feed-to-sheet workflow.
- Reflect: Student reiterates using AI to develop the solution and demonstrates sample outputs, indicating evaluation of the tool’s usefulness.
criteria.reasoning: The submission clearly integrates AI as a core processing step (classification, scoring, and brief explanation) tied into an automated RSS-to-Google-Sheet pipeline and demonstrates sample outputs that show the AI adds actionable value. The student describes the implementation and provides examples, meeting the requirements for a thorough, effective AI integration.
